title: Skeletons reveal the cost of medieval fashion for pointy shoes
description: Known as poulaines, pointy leather shoes were the height of fashion in 14th century Britain. Medieval men and women about town, however, paid a high price for their fancy footwear: They got bunions.

title: Jewish House Dems condemn Rep. Omar's controversial comments
description: A group of Jewish House Democrats are condemning controversial comments made on Twitter by Rep. Ilhan Omar (D-MN). CNN's Sunlen Serfaty reports the Minnesota senator sparked outrage when she appeared to equate the US and Israel with the Taliban and Hamas, the Palestinian militant group designated as a terrorist organization by the US.

title: 'There is famine in Ethiopia right now,' says UN aid chief
description: Over 350,000 people in Ethiopia's conflict-ravaged Tigray region are experiencing dire hunger, finds a new report by the United Nations and other aid groups.

title: First lady's jacket sends a different message than Melania's
description: First Lady Jill Biden wore a jacket emblazoned with the word "love" during her trip abroad with the President, a "quiet message" that CNN's Kate Bennett says is also a "troll" of her predecessor, Melania Trump. Bennett also previews the Bidens' meeting with Queen Elizabeth II.

title: In photos: Biden's first trip abroad as president
description: President Joe Biden is traveling to the United Kingdom, Belgium and Switzerland for his first international trip since taking office.

title: These teens are defying Kamala Harris. Here's why
description: CNN's Matt Rivers reports on the poor conditions in Honduras forcing citizens to attempt to cross the US border in larger numbers.

title: Hackers steal source code and tools from one of world's biggest video game makers
description: Hackers have broken into the systems of Electronic Arts, one of the world's biggest video game publishers, and stolen source code used in company games, a spokesperson confirmed to CNN Business on Thursday.

title: As the Covid Delta variant spreads, so do fears of new waves. Here's what we know
Analysis: Mitch McConnell was asked about Trump and 2022. His answer is hilarious.
description: This exchange -- between Fox News anchor Bill Hemmer and Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell on Thursday -- is amazing:

title: First Muslim American federal judge in US history confirmed
description: The Senate on Thursday voted to confirm Zahid Quraishi to be a US District Judge for the District of New Jersey, making him the first Muslim American federal judge in US history.

title: Putin sends message ahead of Biden meeting
description: CNN's Matthew Chance details actions taken by Russian President Vladimir Putin ahead of his anticipated meeting with President Joe Biden in Lake Geneva, Switzerland.

title: Ex-employees accuse BrewDog of creating a 'culture of fear'
description: BrewDog, one of the biggest UK craft beer producers, has apologized after dozens of former employees accused the company of fostering a "culture of fear" and fomenting "toxic attitudes towards junior staff."

title: Why some Brits think a cup of tea can fix everything
description: In June 2020, the people of Britain put their differences aside to condemn a brazen act of aggression against their country.

title: The Met will return three African art objects to Nigeria
description: Following recent moves by European museums to return African art treasures to Nigeria, the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York announced Wednesday that it is sending three objects back to the country.

title: 'Wandavision' star has some bad news for fans
description: "Wandavision" actress Elizabeth Olsen reveals that there will almost certainly be no second season of the hit show.

title: Anastasia Pavlyuchenkova reaches maiden grand slam final after defeating Tamara Zidanšek at French Open
description: Anastasia Pavlyuchenkova reached her first grand slam final with a 7-5 6-3 victory against Tamara Zidanšek at the French Open.

title: How the next supersonic jets can succeed where Concorde failed
description: United Airlines has announced it will purchase up to 50 Boom Overture supersonic jets for commercial use by 2029, heralding the return of supersonic passenger flights nearly 20 years after the Concorde was decommissioned.

title: Carrie Underwood and John Legend win Video of the Year at CMT Music Awards
description: Carrie Underwood and John Legend took home the coveted award for Video of the Year at the 2021 CMT Music Awards on Wednesday night.

title: Fan ejected after displaying 'Trump Won' banner
description: Security at multiple major league ballparks this season have removed a fan who displayed a large banner that says "Trump Won." CNN's Shimon Prokupecz reports.

title: Neil deGrasse Tyson weighs in on UFO reports
description: Astrophysicist Neil deGrasse Tyson shares his thoughts on recent reports of US Navy pilots' encounters with UFOs.

title: The world's 'coolest' street revealed by Time Out
description: This past year most of us haven't strayed far from the street where we live, what with Covid-19 lockdowns, stay-at-home orders and travel bans.

title: Why tea is good for you and how to make the perfect cup
description: When made correctly, tea can be a powerful booster to your health. And not just because of its chemicals, simply making a cup of tea could be beneficial to you. CNN turns to a psychologist and a London-based tearista for answers.

title: FBI faces its own racial reckoning while leading probes into police shooting deaths
description: The Federal Bureau of Investigation just unveiled a newly created position to tackle its decades-old diversity problem: chief diversity officer.

title: Amrita Sethi makes artworks from the sound of her own voice
description: We all know the saying "a picture is worth a thousand words," but artist Amrita Sethi believes a word can be worth a thousand pictures.

title: Women are falling behind in India's Covid-19 vaccination drive
description: Many more men in India have received Covid-19 vaccines than women, government data showed on Tuesday, highlighting gender disparity in the country's immunization drive that has also disadvantaged the rural population.

title: Serious cyberattacks in Europe have doubled as criminals exploited the pandemic
description: Significant cyberattacks attacks against critical targets in Europe have doubled in the past year, according to new EU figures obtained by CNN, as the pandemic pushed lives indoors and online.

title: Biden delivers warning to Putin ahead of summit
Military junta charges Aung San Suu Kyi with corruption
description: Myanmar's deposed civilian leader Aung San Suu Kyi has been charged with corruption by the country's military junta, state media reported Thursday, adding to a raft of legal cases against the Nobel Peace Prize laureate.

title: 'That's families for you': Prince Edward discusses the Sussexes and the bereaved Queen
description: Edward, Earl of Wessex, pops his head around the door of the room in St James's Palace and chuckles at the numerous cameras set up for the interview. "Do you have enough?" he laughs.

title: A 'ring of fire' solar eclipse will light up the sky on Thursday
description: The moon will slide between the sun and the Earth on Thursday to create a fiery ring in the sky.

title: Hundreds of mysterious fast radio bursts detected in space
description: Hundreds of mysterious fast radio bursts have been detected in space thanks to a Canadian telescope and an international group of researchers.

title: The Delta variant poses a threat to our return to 'normal'
description: As variants of Covid-19 have spread in the US, the public health policy and programmatic responses have been largely consistent: vaccinate as soon as possible, mask up and keep social distancing. But as vaccinations have increased, there has been a collective relaxation of the masking and distancing that were previously indispensable public health measures.

title: Meth production surged in Asia as economy faltered due to Covid-19, report says
description: Asia's drug cartels adapted quickly to the pandemic in 2020, flooding markets with synthetic narcotics worth tens of billions of dollars even as the global economy ground to a halt, according to a new United Nations report.

title: Investors holding $41 trillion demand action on climate — now
description: Investors managing more than $41 trillion in assets are loudly calling on world leaders to immediately step up their climate game if they don't want to miss out on a wave of clean energy investment.

title: These new Barbies are made from ocean-bound plastic
description: Mattel is launching a new line of Barbies made from plastic that would otherwise become ocean waste.

title: Biden delivers warning to Putin ahead of summit
description:
• Analysis: Biden and Johnson bonhomie may be tested by hard reality
• Analysis: Why Biden's trip is so important

title: South Korea building collapses onto bus during demolition, killing 9
description: At least nine people were killed when a five-story building undergoing demolition collapsed onto a bus in South Korea on Wednesday, according to the country's Ministry of the Interior and Safety.

title: Harvard-bound student on why she donated her $40,000 scholarship
description: CNN's Chris Cuomo speaks to the Massachusetts high school senior that made a request for her school to give her $40,000 scholarship to a community college student during her commencement address.

title: At least 10 killed in attack on Afghanistan mine-clearing workers
description: At least 10 people working to clear mines in northern Afghanistan were killed by gunmen in an attack on Tuesday, according to international demining organization Halo Trust.

title: American Airlines CEO shows up at Southwest flight attendant's wedding a year after their viral meeting
description: One year ago, Southwest Airlines flight attendant JacqueRae Sullivan was feeling overwhelmed by events in the United States following the death of George Floyd.

title: Russian court declares Navalny groups 'extremist' ahead of elections
description: A Moscow court on Wednesday ruled that two organizations linked to jailed Kremlin critic Alexey Navalny are "extremist" groups -- forcing them to shut down and rendering their members ineligible to run in upcoming elections.

title: Biden has run-in with cicada before boarding Air Force One
description: Cicadas wreak havoc before President Joe Biden departed on his first trip abroad as commander-in-chief. CNN correspondent Pete Muntean reports on the bug out.

title: Millions of people in China can't stop watching a pack of wandering elephants
description: At least a dozen buzzing drones monitor them around the clock. Wherever they go, they're escorted by police. And when they eat or sleep, they're watched by millions online.

title: It took 4 hours to transform actress into Tammy Faye
description: Give Jessica Chastain the Golden Mascara Award! Fans go gaga over "The Eyes of Tammy Faye" trailer. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports it took more than mascara to transform the actress.

title: The world's most livable cities in 2021
description: The impact of Covid-19 on global livability has been absolutely devastating.
